title: VW bosses face criminal charges as 'dieselgate' returns to haunt German car giant
text:
“Dieselgate” has come back to haunt Volkswagen with the car giant’s chief executive and chairman charged with market manipulation by German prosecutors.

Chief executive Herbert Diess and chairman Hans Dieter Poetsch, along with Martin Winterkorn, who led the business when the scandal broke in 2015, are accused of failing to tell shareholders about the company’s deception.

Shares in VW reacted immediately to news of the criminal prosecutions, dropping almost 3pc.

It was just the first blow to the German car industry on Tuesday, with Mercedes-owner Daimler paying €870m to settle a probe into it selling diesel cars which did not comply with emissions regulations.
